titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Reginald M. Archibald papers, Rockefeller University Faculty FA146
titlestmt.author: Gladys Lewis

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-11-01 14:51:25 -0400.

change.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvists’ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: Reginald M. Archibald papers, Rockefeller University Faculty

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: biographical material, grant reports, budgets, correspondence, and printed material.

did.unittitle: R.M. Archibald. "Work of Dr. R.M. Archibald and his group"
News from The Rockefeller University. "Biography of R.M. Archibald"
Survey of Sources for the History of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes: Biographical and professional information and Archibald bibliography 1930-1976. [Handwritten numbers, corrections and additions by Ruth Sternfeld.] Photocopy.

did.unittitle: Exchange with Laurenda Daniells, University Archivist, University of British Columbia [re] E.H. Archibald (R.M. Archibald's father) and R.M. Archibald's recollections of childhood connections with the University of British Columbia. Photocopies
R.M. Archibald laboratory interiors in 1949, Founder's Hall, Room 413
L.G. Bowen, NRC/R.M. Archibald exchange [re] R.M. Archibald reprints on investigative work during NRC fellowship

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [re] Descriptions of investigations by Dr. Archibald. Laboratory space and apparatus requirements for setting up the Archibald laboratory at RIMR.
Staff requirements and appointments.
D.D. Van Slyke equipment to R.M. Archibald.

did.unittitle: S.T. Baur? /Archibald [re] Baur's reprint, Nature letter on the "Crystallization of Arginase"
A.R. Dochez/Archibald. Letter of appointment as Physician to RIMR Hospital, effective 1948 January 26
D.D. Van Slyke/Archibald. [re] laboratory helper and preparations
Archibald/A.J. Campo. [re] Van Slyke equipment to Archibald

Archibald/Nobelkommittén. [re] D.D. Van Slyke. Includes excerpt from Journal of Clinical Endocrinology and Metabolism editorial on development of better quantitative methods for clinical chemists, (carbon copy)
Charles Best/Archibald. Invitation as visiting lecturer to School of Graduate Studies, University of Toronto
Archibald/Charles H. Best. Declines invitation and recommends Drs. Ahrens, Rasmussen, Klebanoff and Dziewatkowski
J. Campbell/Archibald, [re] Archibald letter to C. Best
Johns Hopkins University, School of Hygiene and Public Health

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: R.M. Archibald, Professor of Biochemistry during this period.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence deals with staff requirements and appointments, biochemistry courses and textbooks, various expenses and students.

Special interest item: 1948 January 26. Archibald/Dr. Stebbins, Director, School of Hygiene and Public Health, Johns Hopkins University Letter of resignation as of June 30, 1948 to membership in RI Hospital.

did.unittitle: Johns Hopkins University, School of Hygiene and Public Health. Nutrition Foundation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence deals with grants-in-aid made by Millbank Foundation and Nutrition Foundation to help support project on "influence of Hormones on Activity of Enzymes and on Bone Formation" at Johns Hopkins University, School of Hygiene and Public Health. Includes plans and schedules for Eastern District study of underweight and overweight children in white public schools.

did.unittitle: RU Administration 1943, 1960, 1967-1969, and Hospital Vacation Schedules 1961-1964

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Special interest item:

did.unittitle: exchange w/E.B. Smith [re] Levene chemical collection
re Nicola Di Ferrante ms "The Differential Diagnosis of Postpuberal Virilism"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes typescript of ms.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Original committee appointed by Dr. Gasser: R.M. Archibald. Chairman, D.D. Dziewiatkowski, T. Shedlovsky, F.L. Horsfall.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, rules and regulations and changes.

Includes some correspondence with Marguerite V. Patmore, Frank Horsfall, W. Flinn as to those who work with organic solvents (benzine). Also includes Atomic Energy Commission regulations/amendments 1957-1969 with 2 reprints.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: R.M. Archibald, principal investigator, Grant #'s A-2772, A-3347, AM08216, AM02772.

did.unittitle: Applications for staff appointments to RU
American Cyanamid and Chemical Corp 1943. [re] Keralin enzyme concentrate H & K.
American Institute of Chemists 1948. [re] Archibald membership in. Encl: AIC leaflet
Carpenter, Rowena S. 1946 [re] education films on nutrition
Emergency Committee of Atomic Scientists [Signed by A. Einstein]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Encl: Statement and A. Einstein "Atomic War or Peace" Atlantic Monthly reprint.

did.unittitle: Wallerstein Laboratories [re] Mylase P. and Reductone

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes graphs on Arginase.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: R.M. Archibald laboratory, isotope and spectroscopic laboratory budgets. Includes correspondence re equipment, etc. for isotope and spectroscopic laboratories.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: R.M. Archibald laboratory and isotope laboratory budgets.

did.unittitle: American Association of Clinical Chemists. Van Slyke Award

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Dr. Archibald member of Van Slyke award nominating committee in 1957 and 1958.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Board is analogous to various medical specialty boards and organized under sponsorship of ACS, ASBC, AIC, AACC.
Dr. Archibald elected to Board in 1958 and served as Vice-President 1959-1963?

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: File consists of minutes of meetings, resolutions and correspondence as Board develops and determines role. Correspondents, include: Kurt Dubowski, W.A. Wolff, Robert M. Hill, Joseph I. Routh among others.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Dr. Archibald serves as a consultant for the Board.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Deals with Board exams in Clinical Chemistry, standardization of cyanmethemoglobin. Includes set of questions and Dr. Archibald's editing of. Also includes reprint from The Modern Hospital, February 1967, "Why Laboratory Standards Are Substandard". Correspondence primarily with Douglas A. MacFadyen, but includes Bradley E. Copeland and Edward B. Smith.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Dr. Archibald member of Committee on Clinical Chemistry of ASBC [re] training of clinical chemists.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists primarily of drafts of proposals, reports and correspondence with members of Committee on Clinical Chemistry (Robert M. Hill, Wm. J. Darby, M.F. Mason, A.J. Quick) and with members of American Board of Clinical Chemistry. This group cooperated with the AMA Joint Committee to study Paramedical Areas in Relation to Medicine (Dr. R.M. McKeown, Chairman).

did.unittitle: American Society of Biological Chemists. E.V. McCollum Award Committee

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Dr. Archibald member of McCollum Award Committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: E.V. McCollum award presented 1959 April 14, Atlantic City, NJ.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Term Dr. Archibald serves on advisory board of publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Related correspondence primarily with L.T. Hallett, Editor.

Hitchcock, P. Interest in Dr. Archibald's work on barbituates

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between professional colleagues.

Opie, E.L. [re] use of autopsied human kidney

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes copy of portion of Archibald ms on the nature of the reaction between proteins and anionic detergents.

did.unittitle: Richards, D.W. [re] blood with unknown organic acid present

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes ms "Colorimetric Determination of Ammonia by the Phenolate-Hypochloride Reaction"

did.unittitle: Sayers, G. [re] modification of uric acid method

Schmierer, Irving L. [re] suggestions of lecturers from RI
Stander, H.J. [re] analysis of human milk

Waverly Press. Request for diagram of apparatus
Williams, Carroll [re] method for determination of thiouracil in blood
International Congress of Clinical Chemistry, New York City, Hotel Barbizon-Plaza

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Dr. Archibald serves on Committee for Scientific Program, Chairman of Session I and a delegate from NAS/NRC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, program, abstracts of papers in Clinical Chemistry v. 2 (August 1956). Also includes copy of report to NAS/NRC from delegates to Congress, copies of 3 papers and "A Brief Description of the International Council of Scientific Unions (ICSU) 1956 prepared by NAS-NRC Office of International Relations.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Dr. Archibald member of Editorial Board of JBC December 1947-June 1958.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence among editorial staff dealing with procedures, style, costs, appointment of new or additional editors and minutes of meetings.
Correspondents: R.J. Anderson, Warren M. Sperry, D. Wright Wilson, Philip Handler.
Some items of special interest are suggested changes for preparation of mss; 1952 April 2 letter from A.N. Richards recalling JBC early history and financial support by Christian Herter.
[See also: Box (4) Folder 4].

did.unittitle: Journal of Biological Chemistry Reports on Operations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes copy of report to the Council of the American Society of Biological Chemistry on Journal's financial structure as requested at 1953 Spring meeting.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Record by editor of mss received and disposition; i.e. "Accepted", "rejected", "accepted with revision".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Special Correspondence between Editors.
Letters dealing with mss which have required additional opinions from various editors.

did.unittitle: Editorial decision letters on mss submitted for publication in JBC. Pages in each folder numbered consecutively to maintain order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence among editorial staff dealing with procedures, style, costs, appointments of new or additional editors, minutes of editorial meetings and nomenclature.
Correspondents: R.J. Anderson, H.B. Vickery, Philip Handler, John T. Edsall, Wm. H. Stein.
Special interest items:

did.unittitle: Report of JBC Committee on Abbreviation. Fifth draft
List (photocopied) of members of JBC editorial board who served with Dr. Anderson during his term of managing editor 1937-1958
William H. Stein/Archibald. Letter of appreciation for service on JBC editorial board
Journal of Clinical Endocrinology and Metabolism

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Dr. Archibald member of editorial board 1953-1960.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence among editorial staff dealing with procedure, style, costs, appointments of new or additional members, mss reviews by Archibald and others, and meetings.
Special items of interest:

did.unittitle: Report of managing editor of JCEM
Rawson, R.W. /Archibald. Thank you for service on editorial board of JCEM

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hand numbered consecutively as found.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten, many worked out by D.D. Van Slyke. pp 1-75.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Including procedures and protocols of things to be tried.

Urease standardization, colorimetric serum calcium, blood sugar alcohol determination, determination of sulphur drugs. Standardization of phenol, plasma albumin specific gravity, protocols for experiments on use of ninhydrin. pp 1-113.

did.physdesc: Includes drafts and galley proof of ms.

scopecontent.p: Includes 1956 correspondence with David Seligson, reprints by others on Kjeldahl method... including Heller, Plazin and D.D. Van Slyke, "A Study of Conditions for Kjeldahl Determination of Nitrogen in Proteins" JBC 176 (1948) 1401-1420. (Method in this ms based on Heller, Plazin and Van Slyke paper.)

did.unittitle: Archibald, R.M., Finby, M. and DeVito, F. Endocrine Significance of Short Metacarpals. Journal of Clinical Endocrinology and Metabolism 19 (1959) 1312-1322

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Editorial correspondence, drafts of ms, referees comments, photographs of figures. Paper also accepted and presented by Dr. Archibald at Endocrine Society meeting.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Working material and drafts and photographs of figures
[Same as folder 7].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes abstract and paper of case presentation by R.M. Archibald, "The Aarskog-Scott Syndrome" at 1972 June 12-16, Baltimore, Md., Johns Hopkins Medical Institutions/National Foundation-March of Dimes, 5th Conference on the Clinical Delineation of Birth Defects. Also includes a printed announcement of conference, preliminary and partial list of participants and topics. An RU Hospital outpatient case history in 1972, correspondence with V.A. McKusick, James German and others, correspondence with parents and drafts of case report by Archibald and German and drafts of ms by Archibald and German published in 1975, working material and rough draft of ms by others [re] Aarskog-Scott Syndrome.
